content:
Canceling the order should be a straightforward process.

Regarding cashback credit cards, there are several excellent options that can reward your frequent online shopping habits. Here are a few popular ones:

1. **Amazon Prime Rewards Visa Signature Card**: As an Amazon frequent shopper, this card is a great choice. It offers 5% cashback on Amazon purchases, 2% cashback at gas stations, restaurants, and drugstores, and 1% cashback on all other purchases. Plus, you'll get a $70 Amazon gift card upon approval.
2. **Chase Freedom Unlimited**: This card offers 3% cashback on all purchases in your first year up to $20,000 spent, and 1.5% cashback on all other purchases. There's no annual fee, and you'll get a $150 bonus after spending $500 in the first 3 months.
3. **Citi Double Cash Card**: This card provides 2% cashback on all purchases, with no rotating categories or spending limits. You'll earn 1% cashback when you make a purchase and an additional 1% when you pay your bill.
4. **Discover it Cash Back**: This card offers 5% cashback on various categories throughout the year, such as online shopping, gas stations, or restaurants, and 1% cashback on all other purchases. You'll also get a dollar-for-dollar match of your cashback earned at the end of your first year.
5. **Capital One Quicksilver Cash Rewards**: This card provides unlimited 1.5% cashback on all purchases, with no rotating categories or spending limits. You'll also get a one-time $150 bonus after spending $500 in the first 3 months.

These are just a few examples, and there are many more options available. When choosing a cashback credit card, consider the following factors:

* Your spending habits: If you mostly shop online, look for cards that offer higher cashback rates on online purchases.
* Annual fees: Weigh the benefits against the annual fee to ensure it's worth it for your spending habits.
* Introductory offers: Take advantage of sign-up bonuses and 0% APR promotions, but be aware of the regular APR that will apply later.
* Credit score: Check your credit score to ensure you qualify for the card you're interested in.

Remember to always read the terms and conditions, and use your credit card responsibly.
